narrative.title: Xiii Corps - 1941Q1
narrative.situation: British combined_arms_corps deployed in North Africa during 1941Q1.
narrative.objectives: Continuation of Operation Compass - destruction of Italian 10th Army and advance into Cyrenaica. First major British offensive of WWII.
narrative.axis_objective: Hold current positions and prevent Allied breakthrough.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and neutralize Axis defensive positions.

weather.terrain: Coastal Libya - fortified positions (Bardia, Tobruk, Derna), coastal plain, desert pursuit routes, escarpments, urban areas (Benghazi)

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: Combined arms mobile warfare coordination (armor, infantry, artillery)
Deep reconnaissance and intelligence gathering (11th Hussars)
Night movement and navigation in trackless desert terrain
Infantry-tank cooperation tactics (Matildas supporting Australian infantry)

environment.terrain_type: Coastal Libya - fortified positions (Bardia, Tobruk, Derna), coastal plain, desert pursuit routes, escarpments, urban areas (Benghazi)
